Detailed Description

Device Context for the Windows painting sequence.

This class is a device-context class derived from CDCT. It performs a BeginPaint at construction time and EndPaint at destruction time. A CPaintDC object can only be used when responding to a WM_PAINT message, usually in your OnPaint message-handler method.

Definition at line 2658 of file atlgdi.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

WTL::CPaintDC::CPaintDC (  HWND    hWnd )  [inline]
 

Constructor.

This constructor constructs a CPaintDC object, prepares the application window for painting, and stores the PAINTSTRUCT structure in the m_ps data member variable.

Parameters:
hWnd  A Window handle.

Destructor.

The class automatically calls EndPaint at destruction time.

Member Data Documentation

WTL::CPaintDC::m_hWnd
 

Handle to painted window.

This data member contains the handle to the window to which this CPaintDC object is attached. m_hWnd is a variable of type HWND.

Referenced by CPaintDC(), and ~CPaintDC().

WTL::CPaintDC::m_ps
 

The internal PAINTSTRUCT member.

m_ps is a public member variable of type PAINTSTRUCT. It is the PAINTSTRUCT that is passed to and filled out by BeginPaint.

The PAINTSTRUCT contains information that the application uses to paint the client area of the window associated with a CPaintDC object.

Note:
Note that you can access the device-context handle through the PAINTSTRUCT. However, you can access the handle more directly through the m_hDC member variable that CPaintDC inherits from CDCT.

Referenced by CPaintDC(), and ~CPaintDC().
